content: Music therapy is becoming more widely available and is currently offered in a variety of settings, including hospitals, psychiatric facilities, community mental health centers, schools, and nursing homes. Depending on where you live, you may be able to find music therapists working independently in private practice or in larger therapy clinics. You can also ask your healthcare provider or mental health professional for referrals to music therapists in your area. Many insurance plans now cover music therapy as a part of mental health treatment, but coverage may vary depending on the plan and the provider. It is worth checking with your insurance company to see what options are available to you. Additionally, some non-profit organizations offer music therapy services on a sliding scale fee or free of charge depending on the individual's financial situation.
